condition.narrative: LA, Schedule 2, Section I.A.1. The Borrower, through MoIT, shall throughout the implementation of the Project and to thesatisfaction of the Bank, operationalize and maintain a Project Implementation Unit (“PIU”), with terms of reference, staffing,authority and budgetary resources necessary and appropriate to, in the Bank's opinion, effectively carry out the Project.

LA, Schedule 2, Section I.A.2. Not later than ninety (90) days after the Effective Date, the Borrower, through MoIT, shallpurchase or develop, and operationalize, an accounting system acceptable to the Bank for the proper recording of Projecttransactions.

LA, Schedule 2, Section I.A.3. For Part 1.C of the Project, prior to the approval of any proposed new innovation centers orupgrade and/or expansion of existing innovation centers, the Borrower, through MoIT, shall: (a) carry out feasibility studies, outof its own resources, based on terms of reference acceptable to the Bank, for the establishment, upgrade or expansion of saidcenters; and (b) submit said feasibility studies for the Bank's review and no-objection prior to said approvals.

LA, Schedule 2, Section I.B.1. The Borrower, through MoIT, shall maintain, throughout Project implementation, a ProjectOperational Manual (“POM”), in substance and manner acceptable to the Bank, as indicated in the Loan Agreement.

LA, Schedule 2, Section I.C.1 and 2. In carrying out Part 1 of the Project, unless otherwise agreed to between the Bank and theBorrower, the Borrower, through the SBO and MoIT, shall appraise the eligibility of proposed Subprojects and make selections inaccordance with standards, criteria and procedures acceptable to the Bank, as set forth in this Agreement and detailed in the POM,which shall include requiring that the appraisals and selections of OIZs and their respective Subproject investments give dueconsideration to: (a) alignment with the Project objective; (b) assurance that the proposed investments are assessed withappropriate consideration of the feasibility studies, and to show reasonable economic return based on a cost benefit analysis, bedemand-driven, have leveraged private sector financing, and build on established government systems; (c) compliance with the Bank'sfiduciary requirements, Environmental and Social Standards, Section I.E of Schedule 2 of the LA, the Environmental and SocialCommitment Plan, and the Environmental and Social Instruments; and (d) compliance with all other relevant terms of the LA and thePOM, including the exclusion of any Excluded Activities.

LA, Schedule 2, Section I.C.3. The Borrower, through MoIT, shall obtain the Bank's written no-objection prior to the selection of aproposed OIZ, the proposed Subproject investment, and the extension of Sub-financing for the Subproject.

LA, Schedule 2, Section I.D.1-2. For Part 1 of the Project, the Borrower, through MoIT, shall make part of the proceeds of theLoan available, through a public bank, to each OIZ selected and approved in accordance with Section I.C of this Schedule 2 of theLA, on the condition that: (a) the Borrower, through MoIT, and each respective OIZ, represented by an authorized representative ofthe respective OIZ, shall enter into a legally binding, written agreement, with terms and conditions approved by the Bank(“Subproject Agreement”); and (b) the Borrower, through MoIT, and the relevant OIZ shall formally execute the related SubprojectAgreement after the satisfactory completion of the processes specified in Section I.C of Schedule 2, and before the start of anybidding and tendering processes for any of the related goods, works or services for the related Subproject.

LA, Schedule 2, Section I.D.3. Following and based on a procurement process satisfactory to the Bank, the Borrower shall enterinto a Sub-financing Agreement with the beneficiary OIZ that shall specify the principal amount of Sub-financing to be provided bythe Borrower, through MoIT, to the beneficiary OIZ, and the interest maturity, interest rate, markup, charges and/or fees to becharged of the OIZ; all of such terms shall be reasonable and acceptable to the Bank and specified in the POM.

LA, Schedule 2, Section I.D.4. The Recipient shall ensure the full and proper execution of each Subproject Agreement andSub-financing Agreement, and the full and proper conclusion of all required governmental and corporate actions of both the Borrowerand the selected OIZs before proceeding with the respective financing referenced in Section I.D.1 above.

LA, Schedule 2, Section I.E.1 and 2. The Borrower, through MoIT, shall ensure that the Project is carried out in accordance withthe Environmental and Social Standards, and the Environmental and Social Commitment Plan, in a manner acceptable to the Bank.

LA, Schedule 2, Section I.F. The Borrower, through MoIT, shall: (a) prepare and furnish to the Bank not later than forty-five (45)days after the Effective Date in the first year of implementation, and thereafter, December 15th of each year during theimplementation of the Project, a proposed Annual Work Plan and Budget, affording the Bank a reasonable opportunity to exchangeviews on each such proposed Annual Work Plan and Budget, and thereafter ensuring that the Project is implemented with due diligenceduring said following year, in accordance with such Annual Work Plan and Budget as shall have been approved by the Bank.

LA, Schedule 2, Section I.G. The Borrower, through MoIT, shall furnish to the Bank each Project Report not later than forty-five(45) days after the end of each six (6) month period, covering said period.
